recipes.name: Pan Seared Steak
recipes.shortDescription: This Pan-Seared Steak has a garlic rosemary-infused butter that makes it taste steakhouse quality. You’ll be impressed at how easy it is to make the perfect steak – seared and caramelized on the outside, and so juicy inside.
recipes.fullDescription:
Pat dry – use paper towels to pat the steaks dry to get a perfect sear and reduce oil splatter.
Season generously – just before cooking steaks, sprinkle both sides liberally with salt and pepper.
Preheat the pan on medium and brush with oil. Using just 1/2 Tbsp oil reduces splatter.
Sear steaks – add steaks and sear each side 3-4 minutes until a brown crust has formed then use tongs to turn steaks on their sides and sear edges (1 min per edge).
Add butter and aromatics – melt in butter with quartered garlic cloves and rosemary sprigs. Tilt pan to spoon garlic butter over steaks and cook to your desired doneness (see chart below).
Remove steak and rest 10 minutes before slicing against the grain.

recipes.name: Good Old-Fashioned Pancakes
recipes.shortDescription: I found this pancake recipe in my Grandma's recipe book. Judging from the weathered look of this recipe card, this was a family favorite.
recipes.fullDescription:
It's not hard to make homemade pancakes — you just need a good recipe. That's where we come in! You'll find the step-by-step recipe below, but here's a brief overview of what you can expect:

1. Sift the dry ingredients together.
2. Make a well, then add the wet ingredients. Stir to combine.
3. Scoop the batter onto a hot griddle or pan.
4. Cook for two to three minutes, then flip.
5. Continue cooking until brown on both sides.

When to Flip Pancakes
Your pancake will tell you when it's ready to flip. Wait until bubbles start to form on the top and the edges look dry and set. This will usually take about two to three minutes on each side.

recipes.name: Classic Margherita Pizza
recipes.shortDescription: A simple yet delicious pizza with fresh tomatoes, basil, and mozzarella.
recipes.fullDescription: Roll out the pizza dough, spread the tomato sauce, add mozzarella slices, and bake at 220°C for 15 minutes. Garnish with fresh basil.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.shortDescription: A creamy and rich pasta dish with eggs, cheese, and pancetta.
recipes.fullDescription: Cook spaghetti and mix with a sauce made of eggs, grated Parmesan, and crispy pancetta.

recipes.name: Grilled Salmon with Lemon
recipes.shortDescription: A healthy and flavorful salmon recipe with a touch of citrus.
recipes.fullDescription: Brush salmon with olive oil and season with lemon juice and garlic. Grill for 5 minutes on each side.

recipes.name: Chocolate Lava Cake
recipes.shortDescription: A decadent chocolate cake with a gooey molten center.
recipes.fullDescription: Mix melted chocolate, butter, sugar, and eggs. Bake at 180°C for 12 minutes until the center remains soft.

recipes.name: Caesar Salad
recipes.shortDescription: A refreshing and crunchy salad with Caesar dressing and croutons.
recipes.fullDescription: Chop lettuce, mix with dressing, add croutons, and sprinkle with Parmesan.

recipes.name: Garlic Butter Shrimp
recipes.shortDescription: Juicy shrimp sautéed in a garlic butter sauce with lemon juice and parsley. A quick and elegant dinner idea ready in 15 minutes!
recipes.fullDescription:
Pat shrimp dry and season with salt and pepper.
Heat butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté for 30 seconds.
Add shrimp and cook 1-2 minutes per side until pink and opaque.
Squeeze in lemon juice and sprinkle with fresh parsley.
Serve immediately with rice or pasta.

recipes.name: Creamy Mushroom Pasta
recipes.shortDescription: A rich and creamy mushroom pasta that comes together in just 25 minutes. Perfect comfort food for a cozy dinner.
recipes.fullDescription:
Cook pasta according to package instructions. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water.
Heat oil and butter in a pan, sauté mushrooms until golden.
Add minced garlic, cook for 1 minute.
Pour in cream and simmer 3-4 minutes.
Add cooked pasta and cheese. Stir until coated, adding pasta water as needed.
Serve with extra parmesan and cracked pepper.

recipes.name: One-Pan Baked Salmon
recipes.shortDescription: Tender, flaky salmon baked with lemon, garlic, and herbs.
recipes.fullDescription:
Preheat oven to 400°F.
Place salmon on a foil-lined baking sheet.
Brush with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Top with minced garlic, lemon slices, and fresh herbs.

recipes.name: Avocado Toast with Egg
recipes.shortDescription: A nutritious and quick breakfast with creamy avocado, poached egg, and a dash of chili flakes.
recipes.fullDescription: Toast bread slices to your preference. Mash avocado with a pinch of salt and spread on toast. Poach eggs and place one on each slice. Season with pepper and chili flakes. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Beef and Broccoli Stir Fry
recipes.shortDescription: A quick Asian-inspired dinner with tender beef slices and crisp broccoli in a savory sauce.
recipes.fullDescription: Slice beef thinly and marinate with soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cornstarch. Stir fry broccoli until bright green and tender-crisp, set aside. Sauté garlic in sesame oil, add beef and cook until browned. Return broccoli to pan, toss, and serve with rice.

recipes.name: Vegan Chickpea Curry
recipes.shortDescription: A flavorful and hearty curry made with chickpeas, tomatoes, and coconut milk. Perfect for meatless Mondays.
recipes.fullDescription: Sauté chopped onion and garlic in oil until soft. Add curry powder and stir for 1 minute. Pour in tomatoes, coconut milk, and chickpeas. Simmer for 20 minutes. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with rice or naan.
